alert.note: Alert for Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:17AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Sussex County through 600 AM EDT... At 517 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pecks Pond, or 16 miles northeast of Mount Pocono, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newton, Montague, Hopatcong, Franklin, Stanhope, Hamburg, Ogdensburg, Sussex, Branchville, Andover, Flatbrookville, High Point, Lake Mohawk, Greendell, Vernon Valley, Five Points, Pellettown, Crandon Lakes, Highland Lake and Hainesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
